before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"852ed","text":"Disinfect your bench and pipettes using bleach or 70% isopropanol solution ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1odek","text":"This protocol is a low-cost approach for preparing competent cells using 0.1M CaCl2 solution which is useful in cases where commercial competent cells are unaffordable, it is challenging to receive products on dry ice or you do not have an ultra low temperature freezer.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":82,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqvkr","text":"Maintain aseptic technique at all point during this experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1i4n5","text":"0.1M ice cold CaCl2 Solution ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":18,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0jcq","text":"Sterile microcentrifuge tubes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d8vb","text":"Pipettes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8ul","text":"LB broth","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jtda","text":"LB agar","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99ucd","text":"Cold centrifuge (4 deg Celsius) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r595","text":"E. coli ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: Streaking and Isolating Bacteria on an LB Agar Plate

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v3om","text":"Plate an innoculum of Escherichia coli  (e.g. BL21(DE3), JM109) glycerol stock on LB agar without antibiotics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":63,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40m1p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b5muf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sr5k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d50u1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm8dd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5c8ff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl8sg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cki67","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Addgene","can_edit":1,"date":null,"doi":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/streak-plate/","guid":"84C8EC50AFBE11ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":1640,"journal":null,"protocol_id":null,"title":"Streaking and Isolating Bacteria on an LB Agar Plate"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3tep7","text":"There are no antibiotics in the culture, so it will be prone to contamination. If you do not have a refrigerated centrifuge, you can try:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eh98u","text":"putting the rotor in the fridge or freezer prior to use","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"653l6","text":"putting the whole centrifuge in a cold room or walk-in fridge","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cr15e","text":"keeping centrifugation time to the minimum needed to form a pellet that is compact enough not to break apart while you discard the supernatant.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6A3B1000AFC011ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clpou","text":"After each centrifugation, discard the supernatant making sure not to dislodge the cell pellets and repeat previous step as needed to harvest more cells. If using   tubes, we recommend repeating 3-5 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":163,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64dv7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"E69595E0AFBF11ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqrtn","text":"Finally, gently resuspend the cells in    ice cold   calcium chloride (CaCl2) solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":77,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"877bu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cme1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8518v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dicqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"55D67B70D81311EB9AAB8738345035A2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"9858A290AFC011ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":100}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":32,"style":"sub"}],"key":"1qf2b","text":"You can also supplement the CaCl2 solution with 15 % v/v glycerol if you wish to store the cells at   . They should then remain competent for at least 1 year. If you do not add glycerol, you must use the cells immediately. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"biefp","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":44}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"77c2o","text":"Competent cells are not generally stable at   ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fpis2","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"28A4F150AFC111ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"1":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"48F00080AFC111ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mhp7","text":"Pipette    into sterile, ice-cold    microcentrifuge tubes to use immediately for transformation or for storage at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":115,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eau79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e99g2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ajrrd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"64CEBA20D81311EB9AAB8738345035A2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"6D871680D81311EB9AAB8738345035A2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C9FF1850AFC111ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"asij2","text":"It is good practice to quantify the transformation efficiency of your competent cells each time you make a batch by transforming them with a known amount (say 1 µL of 50 ng/µL) of plasmid that contains a positive selection marker and counting the number of transformant colonies. This will help track any discrepancies and ensure you get consistent results.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jrmq","text":" Incubate the culture overnight in a shaker incubator at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf5h1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":43200,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E17FE310AFBC11ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"140","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

This is to prevent condensed water in the plates flooding the LB agar and smearing your growing bacteria.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fln39","text":"Monitor OD600 every 30 min using a photometer or McFarland Standards until OD600 = 0.3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":77,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"a79i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hh8c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1h79v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"544C1790AFBF11ECA793AD2918D1EF2B","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McFarland_standards"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3klks","text":"Take particular care when aspirating the culture that it does not get contaminated as your media does not contain antibiotics. Aspirate over a Bunsen burner or in a microbiological safety cabinet or use other measures to ensure excellent aseptic technique.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
